A copy of the simplest bad workspace is available at http://bronzeagesoftware.com/AthenaBackup/workspace.bad2.tgz

Build ID: 20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open the workspace provided
2. Watch it crash with exception below
3. This first happened with an upgrade from 3.2, so I rebuilt my workspace from scratch, but it happened again.

- Perforce

I'm also seeing this problem. Going to attach a log file - Root cause looks SWT related to me?

Created an attachment (id=73538)
Eclipse configuration of system with problem.
The only common plugin we have is perforce, and that's showing up in my startup logs.

I'm having the same issue and I too have the perforce plugin.  

I've found that the only thing I can do to get the workspace to function again after a crash is

rm -rf ~/$WORKSPACE/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.snap

Of course, that also means that I loose some of my workspace info.


To reproduce:
Cause Eclipse to crash (easy! I'll run out of PermGenSpace all the time.  Apparently this is common with WTP)
Try to start eclipse using the same workspace.
??? Be using perforce plugin as well??

I'm going to forward this issue to the perforce support team.

FYI, Perforce Software has already identified this issue as a high priority.

I can't reproduce this in base Eclipse.  From the logs it appears that the preforce plugins have been accessing the jface classes from threads that cannot be guaranteed to be the UI thread.  We had to fix an instance of this faux pas ourselves in bug 183036.  I don't believe there is anything for us to fix - this should be addressed in the Perforce code.
